Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US — a land where anyone from the upper population levels can succeed — for the most part judges others for their success.

However, in places such as the Netherlands, apparently it is expected that everyone will succeed.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for with enough money one can emigrate. There are persistent stories of brilliant communities on distant planets disharging heavily into orbit. Heading off in their ships, the survivors are sure. They leave a planet affected by a sort of universalized autism.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film.
